intro: Silene horvatii, commonly known as the Horvat's campion, is a flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in the Great Basin and surrounding regions. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers and succulent stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture that helps reduce water loss. Silene horvatii is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early summer, contributing to the floral diversity of its native habitat.
